meanings.definition: The final stage of prophase in meiosis, characterized by the condensation of chromosomes.
meanings.sent1: During diakinesis, chromosomes condense in preparation for cell division.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study diakinesis to understand how chromosomes behave in meiosis.
meanings.sent3: The chromosomes at the diakinesis party were all dressed up and ready to divide!
meanings.sent4: In the diakinesis of life, we all condense our experiences into meaningful moments.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a colorful diagram to explain diakinesis to the students.

meanings.definition: The process of chromosome movement during cell division.
meanings.sent1: Diakinesis is crucial for ensuring proper chromosome distribution in cells.
meanings.sent2: Cell biologists study diakinesis to understand how chromosomes segregate during division.
meanings.sent3: The dance of diakinesis was a hit at the cell party!
meanings.sent4: In the hustle of life, diakinesis ensures each chromosome finds its place.
meanings.sent5: The microscope revealed the intricate details of diakinesis in action.
